title: FRQ Score
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

General Considerations

For Task A, the response must articulate a defensible claim/thesis that responds to the question and establishes a line of reasoning about whether democratic or authoritarian regimes are more effective at responding to challenges presented by multiethnic states using the following course concepts: nationalism; political representation; political violence.

For Task B, the response supports the claim with two pieces of specific and relevant evidence from one or more course countries. The evidence is relevant to one or more of the provided course concepts. Tasks B1 and B2 represent each piece of evidence. Task B is worth 2 points in total.

For Task C, the response correctly explains why the evidence supports the claim or thesis.

To earn points for Task C, the response must first earn a point for Task A articulating a defensible claim/thesis.
descriptions: The response accomplishes none of the tasks set by the prompt. [NOTE: For a student to earn the point for Task C, they must first earn the corresponding point for Task A.]
The response accomplishes one of the tasks set by the prompt. [NOTE: For a student to earn the point for Task C, they must first earn the corresponding point for Task A.]
The response accomplishes two of the tasks set by the prompt. [NOTE: For a student to earn the point for Task C, they must first earn the corresponding point for Task A.]
The response accomplishes three of the tasks set by the prompt. [NOTE: For a student to earn the point for Task C, they must first earn the corresponding point for Task A.]
The response accomplishes four of the tasks set by the prompt. [NOTE: For a student to earn the point for Task C, they must first earn the corresponding point for Task A.]
